brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare reproducibility of the device position and location of the prostate rectum interface between two immobilization devices for radiation therapy of prostate carcinoma.

primary_outcome.measure: Deviation of the prostate rectal interface from its position at time of simulation.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measurments will be taken for at least 5 points on a weekly basis during each course of treatment. Data will be presented for the duration of a course of radiation therapy, up to nine weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ease of utilization and patient tolerance of the device.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Results will be measured at every treatment. Data will be presented for the duration of a course of radiation therapy, up to nine weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Calculated dose of radiation to the rectum of the two immobilization devices will be measured and documented after the radiation treatment plan has been approved.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Documented at each treatment. Data will be presented for the duration of a course of radiation therapy, up to nine weeks.

arm_group.description: Use of Miller enema air tip to fix prostate location and displace rectal tissue during radiation therapy.
Use of Radiadyne Immobilizer Treatment Device to fix prostate location and displace rectal tissue during radiation therapy

intervention.intervention_name: Prostate gland immobilization with rectal balloon
intervention.description: Device: Prostate gland immobilization with rectal balloon (Miller enema air tip or Radiadyne Prostate Immobilizer Treatment Device) to fix prostate location and displace rectal tissue during radiation therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age or older
- Clinically localized T1-3 N0-1 M0 adenocarcinoma of the prostate
- Planned definitive radiation therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior proctectomy
- Rectal surgery within one year
- Proctitis
- Rectal carcinoma
- Anal Stenosis
- History of inflammatory bowel disease
- Scleroderma
- Systemic sclerosis
- Refusal of treatment with immobilization device
